question.text: Read the statements below and identify the one that will not help in increasing the efficiency of gaseous exchange in the alveoli.

options.text: The blood capillaries and alveoli have a large total surface area.
The blood flow is slowed as it passes through the pulmonary capillaries.
The thickness of the respiratory membrane is increased.
The walls of the alveoli and capillaries are very thin

solution.text: The human respiratory system has a very high number of alveoli to maximize exchange rate of gases. Small size and high count increases the surface area for better exchange of gases. The exchange site (alveoli and capillary) consists of thin layer (single layer of cells) to provide short distance for smooth diffusion. For keeping high gradient, the blood reaching the exchange site is very low in  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  level and air taken in has very high concentration of  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  comparatively enabling better diffusion. Blood flow within the pulmonary system is on the lower side to enable better gas exchange. If blood flow is high it will reduce the contact time for RBC to exchange carbon dioxide for oxygen. Increase in thickness of the respiratory membrane decreases the efficiency of gas exchange.
